p: Under FA conditions, both species B. erectus and B. hordeaceus showed a similar pattern of response, being minimal at 20 °C (p = 0.003, Fig. 2b). NUE rates were higher but similar, at 7 °C and 30 °C with the fast-growing B. hordeaceus always having lower values, 12% at 7 °C and 22% at 30 °C (p = 0.007 and p = 0.000, respectively). Responses of NUE to low nitrogen availability were species-specific (Table 1). In the slow-growing B. erectus NUE increased slightly from 7 °C to 20 °C, and then markedly at 30 °C, resulting in a 59% higher NUE when compared to FA conditions. In contrast, the fast-growing B. hordeaceus had similar NUE at 7 °C and 20 °C, which then declined to only 208.4 g/g at 30 °C.
